channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2024021905
item.description:
Report X-2024021905

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024021905: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO A LEAKER AT UNLOAD DOOR 10. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON AND THEN FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. FOUND THIS PACKAGE WAS AFFECTED BY ANOTHER LEAKING PACKAGE. BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO PSC AND AFTER FURTHER EXAMINATION. THE PACKAGE IS SUSPECTED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. X-2024021907: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO A LEAKING PACKAGE AT DOOR 10. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON AND THEN FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. PACKAGE WAS BOUGHT BACK TO THE PSC AND THEN FURTHER EXAMINING THAT THE PACKAGE IS SUSPECTED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED IN PORTLAND WITH A WET SPOT ON THE BOX THE BOX WAS PUT IN A HAZ TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA DescribePack: ONE OF THE PLASTIC BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN A HAZ TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA

item.title: Report X-2024030130
item.description:
Report X-2024030130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: EUGENE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WHEN LOADER WAS LOADING PKG INTO PACKAGE CAR, THEY NOTICED A STRONG ODOR. THEY ALERTED MANAGER TYLER AND HE BROUGHT IT TO RESPONDER. RESPONDER THEN TOOK IT TO THE DMP AREA TO OPEN AND INSPECT THE PACKAGE. DISCOVERED A BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS, N.O.S. CND RETENTION + SCULPTING LIQUID TAPED OVER. AFTER THE SORT WAS DONE, RESPONDER CALLED INTO THE HELP DESK. RESPONDER NOTICED CONTENTS HAD LEAKED INSIDE THE BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024030133
item.description:
Report X-2024030133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE AT UNLOAD DOOR. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH P.P.E ON AND THEN USED THE DECISION TREE AND THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO P.S.C. AND FOUND PYRANHA LEGACY FLY SPRAY FOR HORSES LEAKING INSIDE THE PACKAGE, AEROSOLS FLAMMABLE. THE PACKAGE BOX DOESN'T HAVE ANY HAZMAT MARKING ON THE OUTSIDE.

item.title: Report X-2024030035
item.description:
Report X-2024030035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS RESPONDING TO A CALL AT DOOR, ON ARRIVING RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE CLEARLY MARKED HAZMAT PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR. ON RETURNING TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER AND OPENING THE BOX, RESPONDER FOUND TWO OF THE BOTTLES HAD LEAKED CAUSING VISIBLE DAMAGE TO THE CARTON AS WELL AS THE OTHER BOTTLES IN THE BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024030092
item.description:
Report X-2024030092

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER SAW THIS PACKAGE ON A YELLOW PALLET UNDERNEATH THE EXTENDO OF DOOR 35. PACKAGE WAS VISIBLE WET AND STAINED. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION RESPONDER NOTICED IT WAS A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. RESPONDER BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATING AND PROCESSING. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED UP THE BOX, RESPONDER COULD SEE THAT ALL THE BOTTLES HAD LEAKED. SINCE ALL THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING, THEY WERE PROCESSED INTO THE DMP AS THEY CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALAVGE DRUM.
